1.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Rachel is confronting her boss, Terry.

lines.Line:
Terry, I, I, I know that I haven't worked here very long, but I was
wondering, do you think it would be possible if I got a $100 advance in my salary

It's so that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family. See, every year we
go skiing in Vail, and normally my father pays for my ticket, but I sort of started the
whole independence thing, you know, which is actually why I took this job

Rachel, Rachel, sweetheart. You're a terrible, terrible waitress. Really,
really awful

Ok, I, I hear what you're sayin'. I'm with you. Um, but I, but I'm
trying really hard. And I think I'm doing better. I really do. Does anybody need coffee?
(everyone in the place raises their hand) Oh, look at that

2.SceneDescription: Carol and Susan's apartment, Susan is there. Ross enters.

lines.Line: Hi, is uh, is Carol here
No, she's at a faculty meeting

Oh, I uh, just came by to pick up my skull. Well, not mine, but...Susan:
Come in

Thanks. Yeah, Carol borrowed it for a class, and I have to get it back to
the museum
Kinda like a big face without skin
Yes, I'm familiar with the concept. We can just look for it

Ok. (browsing the apartment) Wow, you guys sure have a lot of books about
bein' a lesbian

Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise, they don't let you
do it.

Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise, they don't let you
do it.
(picking up a book) Hey, hey, Yertle the Turtle. A classic
Actually, I'm reading it to the baby

The uh, the baby that hasn't been born yet? Wouldn't that mean you're...
crazy
What, you don't think they can hear sounds in there
What, you don't think they can hear sounds in there
You're not serious, I mean, you really... you really talk to it
Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice
Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice
Do you uh, do you talk about me
But um, we just refer to you as Bobo the Sperm Guy

3.SceneDescription: The subway, Joey spots a gorgeous woman waiting. He goes up to her.

lines.Line: Uh, hi. We uh, we used to work together

Yeah, at Macy's. You were the Obsession girl, right? I was the Aramis guy.
(pretends to spray cologne) Aramis? Aramis?
I gotta tell you. You're the best in the business
I'm serious. You're amazing. You know when to spritz, when to lay back
/strong> Really? You don't know what that means to me
Ooh, you smell great tonight. What're you wearing
Ooh, you smell great tonight. What're you wearing
Listen, uh, you wanna go get a drink or something
/strong> Yeah. (she gets up, notices something behind Joey) Oh
/strong> I just remembered, I have to do something

lines.Character: (Joey turns around and sees his face on a poster in the subway. The poster says
lines.Line:
What
Mario isn't telling you...V.D., you never know who might have it. A variety of scenes are
shown with the poster displayed all over New York City.

4.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Joey enters, upset.

lines.Line: Set another place for Thanksgiving. My entire family thinks I have VD
Tonight, on a very special Blossom

5.SceneDescription: Carol and Susan's, Ross is preparing to talk to her belly.

lines.Line:
Ok, ok, here we go. (he crouches down near her stomach) Ok, where am I
talking to, here? I mean, uh, well, there is one way that seems to offer a certain
acoustical advantage, but..

Ok, ok, ok, ok, here goes. You know, I, you know, can't do this. Uh, this
is too weird. I feel stupid

So don't do it, it's fine. You don't have to do it just because Susan
does it

6.SceneDescription: Carol and Susan's, Carol is reading, Ross is talking to her stomach.

lines.Line:
And everyone's telling me, you gotta pick a major, you gotta pick a major.
So, on a dare, I picked paleontology. And you have no idea what I'm saying, because, let's
face it, you're a fetus. You're just happy you don't have gills anymore
Look, you don't have to talk to it. You can sing to it if you want
Oh, please. I am not singing to your stomach, ok
Shh! (singing) Here we come, walkin' down the street, get the funniest looks from, everyone we meet. Hey, hey! (to Carol) Hey, uh, did you just feel that
No, no that was the first
No, no that was the first
(singing) Hey, hey, you're my baby, and I can't wait to meet you. When you come out I'll buy you a bagel, and then we'll go to the zoo
(singin) Hey, hey, I'm your daddy. I'm the one without any breasts

7.SceneDescription:
The Subway, Joey sees his poster and he peels off the caption on his poster, revealing more posters underneath. The captions read, as follows:

Bladder Control Problem
Stop Wife Beating
Hemorrhoids?
Winner of 3 Tony Awards...

He's finally happy with that and walks away.
